item.title: Leftover IPA
item.author: luketryan95@gmail.com (Luke Ryan)
item.description: https://www.brewersfriend.com/homebrew/recipe/view/927604/leftover-ipa Distilled water will be used in order to customise the water chemistry (30L plus 2L of tap water for the remaining sparge). Adding 6.5g of calcium sulfate (gypsum), 3g of calcium chloride, 4g of magnesium sulfate (epsom salt) and 1 gram of baking sodat to the strike water will give a mash + sparge water profile of: Calcium 74 ppm Magnesium 13 ppm Sodium 11 ppm Chloride 50 ppm

item.title: Mango IPA
item.author: luketryan95@gmail.com (Luke Ryan)
item.description: This time around, I decided to go with a Mango IPA since I love mango and wanted to try making a fruit beer. I now have my Brewzilla 3.1 35L setup and a better, larger fermentation fridge. Hopefully this will up the quality of my homebrew and make the process a lot easier. The Mango is added during fermentation with the hops and left for a week or two. Mango IPA
